intro: Cecropia leucocoma, commonly known as the white-veined cecropia, is a species of tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Moraceae family, which includes figs and mulberries. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with prominent white veins, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Cecropia leucocoma is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing shelter and food for various animals.
